value.title: Tesla AI Day 2022: Everything You Need To Know
value.excerpt: Tesla’s AI day is their annual showcase of the latest technology across the company’s various business units. While Tesla vehicles gain the majority of the press coverage, they have a wide range of different applications and products that they continue to develop and refine.

value.title: AI and Machine Learning Enter the Kitchen at Chipotle

value.title: Intel CEO on high GPU prices: ‘You should be frustrated’
value.excerpt: Intel revealed the pricing and release date for its upcoming Arc Alchemist GPUs, along with a sobering message on high GPU prices: "ou should be frustrated.

value.title: NVIDIA's new AI model quickly generates objects and characters for virtual worlds
value.excerpt: NVIDIA is looking to take the sting out of creating virtual 3D worlds with a new artificial intelligence model. GET3D can generate characters, buildings, vehicles and other types of 3D objects, NVIDIA says.

value.title: Falkonry Unveils GPU-Based, High-Speed Time Series Anomaly Detection Application
value.excerpt: Falkonry today announced an automated anomaly detection application called Falkonry Insight which operates on high-speed sensor time series data. Insight is the newest addition to Falkonry's Time Series AI Suite to drive higher operational reliability and yield,

value.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: AI language models as-a-service "potentially one of the largest software opportunities ever"
value.excerpt: Nvidia co-founder and CEO Jensen Huang opened his company's fall GTC conference with numerous product and service announcements, including the introduction of two cloud computing services the company will operate.

value.title: NVIDIA gives updates on new GPU technologies at GTC conference
value.excerpt: It announced the GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs, which are powered by the company’s new Ada Lovelace architecture.

value.title: Tech war: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang confident in China market despite US AI chip ban
value.excerpt: Jensen Huang says China continues to present a significant growth opportunity even after Washington restricted the Californian company from exporting two of its top chips to the country.

value.title: Nvidia unveils Drive Thor, one chip to rule all software-defined vehicles
value.excerpt: Nvidia revealed a next-generation automotive-grade chip that will unify a wide-range of in-car technology and go into production in 2025.

value.title: Nvidia introduces DLSS3 to generate AI-powered frames with 4X performance
value.excerpt: Nvidia's DLSS 3 will use AI to estimate the best way to fill out images in the company's latest graphics cards.

value.title: NVIDIA and Booz Allen Hamilton Expand Partnership to Bring AI-Enabled Cybersecurity to Public and Private Sectors
value.excerpt: NVIDIA and Booz Allen Hamilton (NYSE: BAH) today announced an expanded collaboration to bring an AI-enabled, GPU-accelerated cybersecurity platform to customers in the public and private sectors. The platform enables next-generation incident response systems that help customers pinpoint cybersecurity threats.

value.title: Hopper time: Nvidia’s most powerful AI chip yet ships in October
value.excerpt: The H100, part of the "Hopper" architecture, is the most powerful AI-focused GPU Nvidia has ever made, surpassing its previous high-end chip, the A100. The H100 includes 80 billion transistors and a special "Transformer Engine" to accelerate machine learning tasks.

value.title: Top 5 Tech Trends We Should All Know Ahead Of Tesla AI Day
value.excerpt: Tesla’s AI Day is on the horizon. Here are some of the top trends emerging in the field of artificial intelligence that you should know about before the big event later this month.

value.title: Upstart claims its chips beat Nvidia's A100 on AI oomph
